==What to Check For==
Verify that sensitive data is not cached.
==Why==
Avoid caching sensitive data to prevent this data from falling into the wrong hands if the device is stolen or compromised.
==How to Check==
To verify that sensitive data is not cached:
# **Identify sensitive data.** Make a list of types of sensitive information handled by your application. Some examples are: #* Passwords #* Encryption keys #* Personal information # **Identify code that creates temporary files used by the application.** Review the application source code to find functions that are responsible for creating the temporary files to find ones that write sensitive data. # **Verify that sensitive data is not cached.** Examine the code that creates temporary files used by the application to make sure that sensitive data is not stored in them.
==How to Fix==
To prevent caching of sensitive data:
# **Identify sensitive data.** Make a list of types of sensitive information handled by your application. Some examples are: #* Passwords #* Encryption keys #* Personal information # **Identify code that creates temporary files used by the application.** Review the application source code to find functions that are responsible for creating the temporary files to find ones that write sensitive data. # **Remove code that writes sensitive data to temporary files.** Edit the functions that write sensitive data to temporary files to prevent caching of sensitive data.
